page.title: 14Recent changes in Ombersley
page.content: We spoke to people who had lived in the village for a long time to find out how it was changing. We found that although the{woodlands}around the village have not changed much, many of the{fields}have been made larger by taking out the hedges.{The centre}of the village is a{conservation area}so there has been little change to the look of the beautiful black and white {buildings}though one or two cottages have gone. Some of the{shops}have changed. There used to be two bakers, now there is one. There was a haberdashery and even a bank. The P.O. has moved. The best change was the {by-pass.}The village street is quite peaceful now. There was a time when there were often traffic jams and the buildings were dirty.Some people said that{village children}do not seem to play out so much now because of T.V.
